document.masterDocTitle: Studies of Madagascan Ptiliidae (Coleoptera) 1: The Tribe Discheramocephalini including eighteen new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Studies of Madagascan Ptiliidae (Coleoptera) 1: The Tribe Discheramocephalini including eighteen new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Habitus Fig. 10 . Length 0.94–0.96 mm . Colour dark brown; legs and antennae dusky yellow. Antennae very long, antennomeres 3–9 very narrow and parallel sided,
Fig. 44
. Pronotum Figs. 56 , 65 ; 0.24 mm long, 0.32 mm wide, lateral margins slightly angled. Elytra 0.63 mm long, 0.50 mm wide, foveae finer and denser than pronotum, tending to form longitudinal rows.
Female : micropterous/apterous. Spermatheca shows some variation in length, Figs. 82, 83
Etymology. Named in honour of R. Raveloson who collected many of the specimens.
Remarks. The large size, long thin antennae, dark colour and presence of micropterous/apterous females, will quickly distinguish this species.
Differences in length of the spermatheca and tip of the aedeagus suggested that two species might be involved, but the presence of intermediate forms ultimately discouraged this view.

Type data.
Holotype : ♂, Ambohitantely Spec. Res., ABT/08/ 2011 , Forest litter forest edge, sifting, Winkler app. extr., S. 18 ˚ 11 ’ 51.8 ’’ E. 47 ˚ 17 ’03.5’’, 1523 m ,
19 .iv. 2011
, P.Banar & R. Raveloson (BMNH).

Paratypes : all records by Winkler extraction of sieved samples collected in the Ambohitantely Spec. Res. unless stated otherwise. 17 ♀
9 ♂
